common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot-up and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up or failing to launch, particularly after updates (11.1.0, 11.1.1). Issues were linked to data migration problems, stricter hardware requirements, and potential conflicts with OneDrive. Patches (11.1.1, 11.1.2, 3.3.8) were released to address these issues, resolving the problems for most users. Providing logs and system information aided in troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key Points Raised:

* **Multiple users reported issues with PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up or not booting up at all.**
* **The issue seemed to be more prevalent on Windows machines and was potentially related to older processors.**
* **The Pieces support team identified a major migration issue with the 11.1.0 update and released a patch (11.1.1) to address it.**
* **While the issue was supposedly resolved for most users, some individuals still experienced problems even after upgrading to 11.1.1.**
* **The issue specifically on MacOS was initially overlooked due to the focus on Windows troubleshooting.**
* **A separate issue with OneDrive potentially causing conflicts with PiecesOS was identified and resolved.**
* **By the end of the conversation, the majority of users appeared to have their issues resolved, including the original poster.**

### Problems Identified:

* **Major data migration issue with PiecesOS 11.1.0 update.**
* **Potential compatibility issues with older Windows processors.**
* **Difficulties in troubleshooting issues specific to MacOS due to communication issues.**
* **Conflicting software (OneDrive) causing problems with PiecesOS.**

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* **Released patch 11.1.1 to address the data migration issue.**
* **Recommended upgrading to 11.1.1 and restarting the application.**
* **Troubleshooting steps for Windows users, including checking processor age and reinstalling the app.**
* **Identified and resolved the conflict with OneDrive.**
* **Released patch 3.3.8 for the desktop app to prevent hanging issues.**

### Current Status/Outcome:

* **The issue is considered resolved for most users.**
* **The original poster confirmed their issue was fixed.**
* **Patch 3.3.8 for the desktop app is still in the process of being released.**

## Additional Notes:

* The provided conversation highlights the importance of clear communication and thorough troubleshooting when dealing with complex software issues.
* The Pieces support team demonstrated responsiveness and dedication to resolving the issues affecting their users.
* The conversation also showcases the benefits of an open platform like GitHub for collaborative problem-solving and community support.

PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

latest

## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* Users were experiencing issues with launching the Pieces app after updating to 11.1.1.
* The issue was related to stricter hardware requirements than initially expected.
* Pieces support requested logs for troubleshooting.

**Problems Identified:**

* App launch failure after updating to PiecesOS 11.1.1.
* Stricter hardware requirements causing compatibility issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Patch release scheduled within 24-48 hours.

* Issue closed.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS launch failure due to database error
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported Pieces OS failing to launch on Ubuntu, Windows, and macOS due to a "DatabaseException" related to the "CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch" extension. The issue stemmed from older CPUs lacking AVX2 support. The Pieces team resolved the issue by releasing version 11.1.2, which included a patch to address the AVX2 requirement. Users experiencing this issue are advised to update to the latest version.

related_issues.title: Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
related_issues.text:
Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Faccing "DatabaseException(Unable to load 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extenstion" (1), code : can'tOpenFile)" on my ubuntu desktop 
## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces App Boot Up Issue

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@Rohit0072) reported an issue with the Pieces app failing to boot up.
* The user was searching for a solution and provided details about the problem.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces app was unable to boot up, rendering it unusable.
* This issue appeared related to several other reported problems (#620, #624, and #625).

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team acknowledged the issue and suggested relevant resources.
* They provided contact information for further assistance.
* A fix was implemented and released in version 11.1.2 of PiecesOS.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user was advised to update to the latest version and report back if the issue persists.
* The issue was closed, assuming the fix resolved the problem.

**Additional Information:**

* The user can reopen the issue if the problem continues after the update.

**Overall, the Pieces team promptly addressed the reported issue and provided effective solutions.**

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:

**Problem:** Pieces application wouldn't boot due to an error involving the "CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch" extension, specifically related to AVX2 not being supported on the user's processor.

**Key points:**

- User reported the issue and provided logs.
- The Pieces team acknowledged the issue and confirmed it affected multiple users.
- It was related to a database service hardware requirement.

**Solutions:**

- The Pieces team worked on a solution around the clock.
- A patch was released within 48 hours of the issue being reported.

**Outcome:**

- The user updated to PiecesOS version 11.1.2 and confirmed the issue was resolved.

**Current status:**

- The issue is resolved.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:**

Several users were experiencing issues with the latest version of the Pieces application, particularly those using older CPUs that lack AVX2 support.

**Identified Issues:**

* AVX2 requirement for `CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch` extension caused incompatibility with older CPUs.
* Users with pre-2016/2017 CPUs were unable to run Pieces.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team actively worked on a solution and released version 11.1.2 to address the AVX2 issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is confirmed to be fixed with the release of version 11.1.2.
* Users are encouraged to update to the latest version for a smooth experience.

**Additional Notes:**

* The team is actively seeking feedback from users and exploring further improvements.

**Key Points:**

* AVX2 requirement was the root cause of the issue.
* The team quickly responded and released a fix.
* Users with older CPUs should update to the latest version for resolution.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported issues with PiecesOS booting and launching after updating to version 11.1.0 and 11.1.1. The issues seem to stem from compatibility problems and stricter hardware requirements. Solutions included reinstalling the correct version for the architecture, waiting for a patch release (11.1.2), and providing logs for further troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 ## GitHub Issue Summary: **Key Point:** The issue has been resolved. **Original Issue:** * No information provided about the original issue or its details. **Solutions:** * No information provided about any proposed or implemented solutions. **Current Status:** * The issue is marked as "resolved". **Outcome:** * No information provided about the outcome or any remaining concerns.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Connectivity and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to connect to cloud services or launch, often encountering "Unable to sign in" errors. This might stem from network configuration, firewall restrictions, or software bugs. Suggested solutions include checking internet connection, verifying firewall settings, ensuring PiecesOS is updated, and consulting Pieces support.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohanrathi99 is experiencing issues with PiecesOS, encountering both cloud service and local model problems.
* The issue might be caused by a firewall or network configuration blocking outgoing requests.

**Problems Identified:**

* User is unable to make requests to PiecesOS cloud services.
* User encounters difficulties with local models.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggests sending logs for `com.pieces.os` and `com.pieces.pfd` for further investigation.
* A calendar link is provided for real-time debugging if preferred.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user is yet to respond with the requested logs or choose real-time debugging. 
* The issue remains unresolved. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation references two related issues: "Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response" and "Ensure core dependencies  Retry Step , I need help #bug". 
* The user is also provided with links to helpful resources like existing issues, documentation, and the YouTube channel.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Connectivity and Service Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with PiecesOS connecting to cloud services and utilizing local LLMs.  This is likely due to network configuration or firewall issues.  Solutions include checking network settings, firewall rules, and upgrading to the latest PiecesOS version (11.1.2).

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @AmanSingh766 is experiencing an exception when downloading local LLMs.
* The error message is: "Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress"

**Problems Identified:**

* User is unable to download local LLMs.
* The root cause of the exception is unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support requested support logs from the user.
* Pieces support suggested that the issue might be resolved in version 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was potentially resolved in version 11.1.2.
* The user is requested to confirm if the issue is still present. 
* The issue will be reopened if the problem persists.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of PiecesOS boot and launch issues:** These issues are the most frequent and impactful, causing frustration for users upgrading to newer versions. Focus on addressing the root causes, such as data migration problems, hardware compatibility, and conflicts with other software like OneDrive.
**Improve communication and troubleshooting for MacOS users:** Ensure dedicated support and resources are available for MacOS users to avoid overlooking platform-specific issues.

**Investigate and address connectivity and cloud service issues:** Identify the root causes of connection failures, including network configuration, firewall restrictions, and potential software bugs. Provide clear troubleshooting steps for users experiencing these issues.

**Enhance error messaging and logging:** Provide more informative error messages to users, clearly explaining the problem and potential solutions. Improve logging mechanisms to aid in faster and more efficient troubleshooting.

**Proactively monitor for emerging issues:** Implement systems to track common issues and user reports, allowing for quicker identification and resolution of widespread problems. Consider setting up monitoring for error logs and user feedback channels.

**Create a comprehensive knowledge base:** Develop a detailed knowledge base with articles, FAQs, and troubleshooting guides covering common issues, installation instructions, and feature explanations. This will empower users to self-serve and reduce the support load.

**Consider hardware requirements in future updates:** Clearly communicate any changes in hardware requirements to users before releasing updates. Provide compatibility information and alternative solutions for users with older hardware.

**Gather user feedback on updates:** Implement a system for gathering user feedback on new releases and updates. This will help identify potential issues early on and improve the overall user experience.

**Improve support bot's effectiveness:** Enhance the support bot's ability to understand and respond to user queries. Provide it with more comprehensive information and train it on past support interactions to improve its accuracy and helpfulness.

**Explore real-time debugging options:** Offer real-time debugging sessions for complex issues that require direct interaction with support agents. This can expedite the troubleshooting process and improve user satisfaction.
